title: Ticket #3985: condor_q -analyze crashing with illegal instruction
description:
condor_q -analyze is crashing in CHTC on the following Requirements expression. 

Requirements =
( ( Target.SlotID < 2 && HasVMJahnsKvm ) &&
  ( MY.JobUniverse == 12 || MY.JobUniverse == 7 ||
    MY.WantFlocking || MY.WantGlidein || TARGET.PoolName == "CHTC" ||
    TARGET.COLLECTOR_HOST_STRING == "infopool.cs.wisc.edu" ) &&
  ( TARGET.Arch == "X86_64" ) &&
  ( TARGET.HasVM ) &&
  ( TARGET.VM_Type == "kvm" ) &&
  ( TARGET.VM_AvailNum > 0 ) &&
  ( TARGET.Disk >= RequestDisk ) &&
  ( TARGET.HasFileTransfer &&
    stringListMember("file",HasFileTransferPluginMethods) ) ) &&
( TARGET.FileSystemDomain == MY.FileSystemDomain ) &&
( TARGET.TotalMemory >= 1968 ) &&
( TARGET.VM_Memory >= 1968 ) &&
( TARGET.VM_Networking ) &&
( stringListIMember("nat",TARGET.VM_Networking_Types,",") )
remarks:
2013-Oct-15 09:30:00 by johnkn:
Stepping through the code shows that the problematic part of this expression is 

    ( stringListIMember("nat",TARGET.VM_Networking_Types,",") )

The enclosing () are required, as is the fact that this is a function. The underlying bug (a bad cast) has been in the code since the original analyze went in, but it only began to manifest as a crashing bug when we shrunk some of the classad nodes in 7.9.x.

2013-Oct-15 10:36:09 by jfrey:
Code Review

This code change looks good.
